page.title: 17THE WAENDEL WALK
page.content: Since it began in{1979}this event has become an international one with people from all parts of the world participating. There are three distances that those taking part can tackle:-{9 km. 18 km. or 27 km.}The event is non-competetive and takes place over a weekend in the early part of June. The event is named after a tribal leader of the area, Waendel, who, it is thought, gave his name to Wellingborough. All the walks start and end at Weavers Sports Centre and cover as much of the Borough of Wellingborough as possible. The emphasis is on participation and enjoyment for whoever takes part. Many who take part, for example scout groups, camp for the weekend on the centre's outdoor areas.
